protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
description:
This protocol is a group of the following 5 methods from the NEB website:
1. NEBNext End Prep
2. Adaptor Ligation
3. Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
4. PCR Amplification
5. Cleanup of PCR Amplification

materials.reagent_name: NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina - 24 rxns

warning: This protocol is suitable for input amounts of 50 ng or higher. For lower input amounts we recommend that the protocol without size selection be followed.
guidelines:
The NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina contains enzymes and buffers that are ideal to convert a small amount of DNA input into indexed libraries for next-generation sequencing on the Illumina platform (Illumina, Inc). 

Adaptor Ligation:

If DNA input is < 100 ng, dilute the NEBNext Adaptor for Illumina* 1:10 and use immediately to a final concentration of 1.5 μM.

Size Selection:

This protocol is suitable for input amounts of 50ng or higher. For lower input amounts we recommend that the protocol without size selection be followed.

This size selection is for libraries with 200 bp inserts only and is based on a starting volume of 100 µl. For libraries with different size fragment inserts, refer to Table 1 for  the appropriate volume of beads to be added. 

Table 1: Recommended conditions for bead based size selection. 

LIBRARY
PARAMETERS		 APPROXIMATE
INSERT SIZE		 150 bp 200 bp 250 bp 300-400 bp 400-500 bp 500-700 bp
Total Library Size (insert + adaptor) 270 bp 320 bp 400 bp 400-500 bp 500-600 bp 600-800 bp
VOLUME TO
BE ADDED (μl)		 1st Bead Selection 65 55 45 40 35 30
2nd Bead Selection 25 25 25 20 15 15



Figure 1: Examples of libraries prepared with human IMR-90 gDNA.

components.data:
Mix components

Mix the following components in a sterile nuclease-free tube (Total volume 65 μl):

 

Reagent Cap Color Volume
Fragmented DNA    55.5 μl
End Prep Enzyme Mix Green 3.0 μl
End Repair Reaction Buffer (10x) Green 6.5 μl

source_data.annotation: Set a 100 or 200 μl pipette to 50 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect the liquid from the side of the tube. Note: it is important to mix well. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with the performance. See the guidelines section for a picture of acceptable amounts of bubbles.

Time Temperature
30 minutes 20°C
30 minutes 65°C
Hold 4°C

components.data: NEBNext End Prep
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add the following components directly to the End Prep reaction mixture:

Reagent Cap Color Volume
Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix Red 15 μl
Ligation Enhancer Red 1 μl
NEBNext Adaptor For Illumina Red 2.5 μl

components.data: Adaptor Ligation
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation:
The NEBNext adaptor is provided in NEBNext Singleplex (NEB #E7350) or Multiplex (NEB #E7335,  #E7500,  #E7710, #E7730, #E6609, #E7600) Oligos for Illumina.

 

if DNA input is < 100 ng, dilute the NEBNext adaptor for Illumina (provided at 15 μM) 10 fold in 10 mM Tris HCl with 10 mM NaCl to a final concentration of 1.5 mM,. Use immediately. 

 

Ligation enhancer and Blunt TA Ligase Master Mix can be mixed ahead of time are is stable for at least 8 hours at 4°C. We do not recommend adding adaptor to a premix in the adaptor ligation step. For best results add adaptor last and immediately mix well, or premix adaptor and sample and then add the other ligation reagents.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation:
USER addition and USER incubation are only required for use with NEBNext adaptors. 

USER is provided in the NEBNext Index Primer kits. It is also available as a separate product NEB# M5505 which can be used in NEBNext library prep workflows.
source_data.thread_text:
USER addition and USER incubation are only required for use with NEBNext adaptors. 

USER is provided in the NEBNext Index Primer kits. It is also available as a separate product NEB# M5505 which can be used in NEBNext library prep workflows.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 8 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation:
Samples can be stored overnight at -20°C, for longer term storage the samples should be cleaned up or size selected. 

If moving on to PCR in the same day, take the NEBNext Q5 Hot Start HiFi PCR Master Mix at room temperature during size selection or cleanup. Once thawed, gently mix by inverting the tube several times.
source_data.thread_text:
Samples can be stored overnight at -20°C, for longer term storage the samples should be cleaned up or size selected. 

If moving on to PCR in the same day, take the NEBNext Q5 Hot Start HiFi PCR Master Mix at room temperature during size selection or cleanup. Once thawed, gently mix by inverting the tube several times.
source_data.body:
Samples can be stored overnight at -20°C, for longer term storage the samples should be cleaned up or size selected. 

If moving on to PCR in the same day, take the NEBNext Q5 Hot Start HiFi PCR Master Mix at room temperature during size selection or cleanup. Once thawed, gently mix by inverting the tube several times.

components.data: Vortex SPRIselect beads to resuspend. AMPure XP beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP beads, please allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex SPRIselect beads to resuspend. AMPure XP beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP beads, please allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use.

components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation:
Please note: the volumes of SPRIselect or AMPure XP reagent provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. These volumes may not work properly for a size selection at a different step in the workflow, or if this is a second size selection at this step. For size selection of samples contained in different buffer conditions the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.

! The following size selection protocol is for libraries with 200 bp inserts only. For libraries with different size fragment inserts, refer to the Table1 in the Guidelines for the appropriate volumes of beads to be added. The size selection protocol is based on a starting volume of 100 μl. Size selection conditions were optimized with AMPure XP beads; however, SPRIselect beads can be used following the same conditions.

 

Insert/ total library size; first/ second bead addition volume

150/ 270; 65/25

200/ 320; 55/25

250/ 400; 45/25

300-400/ 400-500; 40/20

400-500/ 500-600; 35/15

500-700/ 600-800; 30/15
source_data.thread_text:

These volumes may not work properly for a size selection at a different step in the workflow, or if this is a second size selection at this step. For size selection of samples contained in different buffer conditions the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.

For libraries with different size fragment inserts, refer to the Table1 in the Guidelines for the appropriate volumes of beads to be added. 250/ 400; 45/25

300-400/ 400-500; 40/20

400-500/ 500-600; 35/15

500-700/ 600-800; 30/15

components.data: Add 13.5 μl dH2O to the ligation reaction for a 100 μl total volume.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 13.5 μl dH2O to the ligation reaction for a 100 μl total volume.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

components.data: For 200 bp inserts add 55 μl (0.55 x) of resuspended SPRIselect beads to the 100 μl ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For 200 bp inserts add 55 μl (0.55 x) of resuspended SPRIselect beads to the 100 μl ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation: Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
source_data.body: Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.

components.data: Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.

components.name: Section

source_data.body: If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.

components.data: After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully transfer the supernatant containing your DNA to a new tube (Caution: do not discard the supernatant). Discard the beads that contain the unwanted large fragments.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully transfer the supernatant containing your DNA to a new tube (Caution: do not discard the supernatant). Discard the beads that contain the unwanted large fragments.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

components.data: For 200 bp libraries, add 25 μl (0.25 x) resuspended SPRIselect beads to the supernatant and mix at least 10 times. Then incubate samples on the bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For 200 bp libraries, add 25 μl (0.25 x) resuspended SPRIselect beads to the supernatant and mix at least 10 times. Then incubate samples on the bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.name: Section

source_data.thread_text: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the desired DNA targets
source_data.body: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the desired DNA targets

components.data: Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 18 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.
source_data.body: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

components.data: Repeat the previous step once. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat the previous step once. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

components.data: Air the dry beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic stand with the lid open. Caution: Do not overdry the beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Air the dry beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic stand with the lid open. Caution: Do not overdry the beads.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 21 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation: Caution: Do not overdry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.
source_data.thread_text: Caution: Do not overdry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.
source_data.body: Caution: Do not overdry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.

components.data: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads into 17 μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl or 0.1X TE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads into 17 μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl or 0.1X TE.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down 10 times. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down 10 times. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Size Selection
components.name: Section

source_data.annotation: According to the comments, this is a safe stopping point. After the ligated fragments have been purified, it's ok to freeze overnight and start the PCR amplification step the following day.

components.data:
Mix the following components in sterile strip tubes (Total volume  50 μl):

 

For index kits with primers separate: 

Reagent Cap Color Volume
Adaptor Ligated Fragments n/a 15 µl
NEBNext Q5 Hot Start HiFi PCR Master Mix Blue 25 µl
Index Primer/ I7 primer Blue 5 µl
Universal PCR primer/ I5 Primer Blue 5 µl

 

For Index kits where the primers are already combined: 

Reagent Cap Color Volume
Adaptor Ligated Fragments n/a 15 µl
NEBNext Q5 Hot Start HiFi PCR Master Mix Blue 25 µl
Index/ Universal Primer   10 µl

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 39 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation:
The primers are provided in NEBNext Singleplex (NEB #E7350) or Multiplex (NEB #E7335, #E7500, #E7710, #E7730, #E6609, #E7600) Oligos for Illumina.

Check that your primers are 10 μM (tube label).
source_data.thread_text:
The primers are provided in NEBNext Singleplex (NEB #E7350) or Multiplex (NEB #E7335, #E7500, #E7710, #E7730, #E6609, #E7600) Oligos for Illumina.

Check that your primers are 10 μM (tube label).
source_data.body:
The primers are provided in NEBNext Singleplex (NEB #E7350) or Multiplex (NEB #E7335, #E7500, #E7710, #E7730, #E6609, #E7600) Oligos for Illumina.

Check that your primers are 10 μM (tube label).

source_data.reagent_name: NEBNext® Q5® Hot Start HiFi PCR Master Mix

components.data:
PCR using the following cycling conditions:

 

Cycle Step Temperature Time Cycles
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 Seconds 1
Denaturation 98°C 10 Seconds 4-12*
Annealing/ Extension 65°C 75 Seconds
Final Extension 65oC 5 Minutes 1
Hold 4°C ∞  

 

* Please note the number of PCR cycles recommended in this table are to be seen as s starting point to determine the number of PCR cycles best for your samples. The number of cycles should be chosen based on the input amount and sample type. Thus, samples prepared with a different method prior to library prep may require further re-optimization of the number of PCR cycles. The number of cycles should be high enough to provide sufficient library fragments for a successful sequencing run, but low enough to avoid PCR artifacts and over-cycling (high molecular weight fragments on Bioanalyzer). 

 

DNA Input Number of PCR Cycles
1 µg 4
50 ng 7-8
5 ng 12

 

The NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
PCR using the following cycling conditions:

 

Cycle Step Temperature Time Cycles
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 Seconds 1
Denaturation 98°C 10 Seconds 4-12*
Annealing/ Extension 65°C 75 Seconds
Final Extension 65oC 5 Minutes 1
Hold 4°C ∞  

 

* Please note the number of PCR cycles recommended in this table are to be seen as s starting point to determine the number of PCR cycles best for your samples. The number of cycles should be chosen based on the input amount and sample type. Thus, samples prepared with a different method prior to library prep may require further re-optimization of the number of PCR cycles. The number of cycles should be high enough to provide sufficient library fragments for a successful sequencing run, but low enough to avoid PCR artifacts and over-cycling (high molecular weight fragments on Bioanalyzer). 

 

DNA Input Number of PCR Cycles
1 µg 4
50 ng 7-8
5 ng 12

 

The NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences.

source_data.annotation: If using AMPure XP beads, allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use.

source_data.body: If using AMPure XP beads, allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use.

components.data: Add 45 μl (0.9X) resuspended SPRIselect beads to the PCR reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 45 μl (0.9X) resuspended SPRIselect beads to the PCR reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 27 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation: Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
source_data.body: Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.

components.data: Incubate for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant (5 min or when the solution is clear).
components.name: Description

source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation: If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
source_data.thread_text: If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
source_data.body: If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.

components.data: After the solution is clear (about 5 minutes), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets (Caution do not discard beads).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the solution is clear (about 5 minutes), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets (Caution do not discard beads).

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash #1: Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/ plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #1: Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/ plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 31 of NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEBNext® Ultra™ DNA Library Prep Protocol for Illumina® With Size Selection (E7370)
source_data.annotation: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.
source_data.body: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

components.data: Wash #2: Repeat the previous once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #2: Repeat the previous once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open. 

Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open. 

Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding 33 μl of 0.1X TE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding 33 μl of 0.1X TE.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix well by pipetting up and down 10 times, or on a vortex mixer. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well by pipetting up and down 10 times, or on a vortex mixer. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Place the tube/plate on the magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 28 μl to a new PCR tube for and store at -20oC.15
